basics.name: Jett Perry
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Airman in the Hawaii Air National Guard pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii, specializing in Software Engineering and Game Development. Expected to graduate in Fall 2026.

education.institution: Leeward Community College, Pearl City, HI

work.summary: Maintained and repaired C-17 Globemaster Aircraft
highlights: Met safety requirements through routine and special inspections, documenting findings and repairs undertaken.
Restored functionality and improved performance by modifying aircraft structures, systems and components.
Collaborated positively with peers to maintain friendly, supportive and cooperative work atmosphere.
Read and interpreted maintenance manuals to determine feasibility and method of repairing and replacing malfunctioning or damaged components.
Managed complex projects with high level of organization, time management and attention to detail.
Oversaw 20,000+ currently enrolled University of Hawaii students who have received scholarships, grants, etc.
Assisted with finding scholarships for University of Hawaii students in various fields of study while working with classified data.

volunteer.summary: HUGS is a small non-profit that helps families with children who are seriously ill.
highlights: Helper at 2023 and 2024 SIB Camp where we watch over the brothers and sisters of seriously ill children ensuring their mental wellbeing.
Worker at the HUGS Met Gala where we raised over $10,000 to help provide financial support for our HUGS families.

awards.title: Air and Space Achievement Medal
awards.summary: During this period Airman Perry's outstanding work as an Aircraft Mechanic Journeyman increased aircraft reliability by 97%, exceeding the Department of Defense's goal by 3.2%.
